meanings.definition: A line of verse or poetry.
meanings.sent1: The poem had beautiful stichs that painted vivid images in my mind.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed writing stichs that rhymed and flowed smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The stichs in the poetry competition made everyone laugh with their clever twists.
meanings.sent4: Her stichs of emotion stitched together a tale of love and loss.
meanings.sent5: The stichs of the poem embroidered a tapestry of feelings and thoughts.

meanings.definition: A sudden sharp pain in the side.
meanings.sent1: After running, he felt a sharp stichs in his side.
meanings.sent2: The stichs in her side made it hard to breathe during the race.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected stichs during the game caught him by surprise.
meanings.sent4: Each stichs in her side felt like a tiny dagger piercing through.
meanings.sent5: The stichs in his side were a reminder of pushing himself to the limit.

meanings.definition: To sew or mend with stitches.
meanings.sent1: She carefully stichs the torn fabric back together.
meanings.sent2: He stichs the buttons onto the shirt with precision.
meanings.sent3: The tailor stichs the pieces of cloth together with expertise.
meanings.sent4: She stichs memories into the fabric of her life.
meanings.sent5: His hands deftly stichs the leather, creating a masterpiece.
